intro: Pentas caffensis, commonly known as the star cluster or African star flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, five-petaled flowers that resemble small stars. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, opposite leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers bloom in clusters, producing a striking display of red, pink, or white hues, making it a popular ornamental plant.
